job_title: Behavioral Health Counselor in Woodland, CA
pros: Great supervision and room to grow in the agency. Good opportunities for training
cons: Low pay and feel burnout quick

review_title: Great place, needs work on management
job_title: Patient Service Representative in West Sacramento, CA
Life Skills Coach in Royal Oak, MI
pros: Some good people and great location
cons: Not enough training, definitely not nearly enough pay

review_title: Incredibly Poor Upper Management and Training
pros: Their salary is in the higher range.
cons: I was left alone without direction from my supervisor, who either called in sick or worked remotely. After 5 weeks of employment I never received training, not even new employee training, so that I could start my job. When I emailed upper management they asked me to quit voluntarily for: "sending a complaining email" about my supervisor. This organization does not value employee's skills or work experiences, nor do they value the clients they are supposed to serve. What they do value: never complaining if you have a problem, socializing for the majority of your time and always being super nice to upper management. Women of Importance never get there by being "nice." That's why when they asked me to voluntarily quit for voicing my concerns, saying that I would receive unemployment that way, in lieu of being fired, I quit.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in West Sacramento, CA
pros: The insurance is kinda okay. They should do better

job_title: Director of Business Development in Columbus, OH

review_title: Enjoyed working with highly skilled team players that had a passion for serving an underprivileged community.
job_title: Dental Program Administrator in Davis, CA
pros: You are afforded the opportunity to make a difference everyday in some ones health care and work with committed teams throughout the medical and dental services. Great opportunity to work with volunteer students who went on to pursue their goals of becoming a dentist.
cons: Not enough hours in the day to serve and meet the needs of the community. Having to turn anyone away who needed dental care was never easy. You'll miss it when your gone.

pros: Working with clients in the community was a good experience
cons: Training was minimal, expectations from leadership unrealistic, high turnover, unskilled leadership, favoritism, low morale

job_title: Family Support Worker in Woodland, CA
pros: Agency is a forward looking healthcare center with emphasis on behavioral health and seems to make a true difference in their community.
cons: Not much room for advancement for anyone without an MA

pros: Employees had access to seek treatment by on staff physicians if they felt it.
cons: Low wages, poor leadership which led to low morale. Employees did not feel valued. Leadership were always praised and rewarded while the front line staff were pressured daily.

pros: Good midwives and support personnel. Great clients
cons: Little to no opportunity for advancement in rank, although there are pay raises tied to the annual evaluation

review_title: I enjoyed the experience and the patient population
